Forwarding to the build component...
What do you mean by "Resume the project programmatically"?

Mikhail

Just recreate and reopen the project programmatically.
By recreating a project present in the filesystem but not in the workspace, it will resume it.

Can you attach a sample code you are using for the project creation so that I could reproduce the problem.

Thanks,
Mikhail

No, I'm sorry.
We discovered that problem during a test and bugfixing phase some times ago, and now we worked it around.
What we do is the following thing.
1) We create a C managed project with the CDT infrastructure - code copied from your wizards (I hope the API for doing such things has been improved in version 3.1 - we experienced some strange deadlock behaviour too, ... never been able to reproduce)
2) We add information to the BuildInfo (include Paths / libraries / ...)
3) We save the build info.

During test and bugfixing we discovered the funny Eclipse behaviour of resuming projects deleted from Workspace but not from FileSystem.

We made a first attempt to solve the problem by stopping our process and warn the user that the project already exists in the FileSystem ...
but in Eclipse we found no way to make a programmatic distinction between new projects and zombies projects.
We just had the exception of BuildInfo in CDT ... but it was cought deeper in the code.

We hence decided to let zombies exists (what is not really user freandly ... the user delete a project, make the mistake of deleting it only from workspace, and then recreate the project with all the old stuff still inside - but is not your problem).
We hence found a way to workaround the exception that is thrown by CDT. By looking in the code I think it is done by letting the BuildInfo beeing recreated like for a new project (but I'm not sure).

Looks like this is something similar to the bug#43020. We're going to enhance the project creation mechanism in 4.0. Along with this we will investigate the problem of creating the project in the directory that already contains the project info.
Targetting to 4.0 for now..
You can't have a target milestone set if no one has taken ownership of the bug to commit to the milestone.
